page.title: 15French Kier Construction
page.content: In 1967 the company now renamed French Kier moved its headquaters to Tempsford Bedfordshire in the grounds of the old manor house.The main reason for this move was economical Tempsford rates being much cheaper than London,plus the sight was by the side of the A1 trunk road so London was less than an hours drive away. Today the company is one of the major employers in the area. It has developed a high reputation in building bridges, large jetties,and multi storey car parks. The famous blue square {FK}symbol is a common sight today and it is this sign which first catches the eye as you enter Tempsford Hall grounds,perhaps an unlikely home for a great Empire builder.
